description:
The film takes place on a certain isolated island, at a certain middle school, on the eve of the culture festival. A boy quits baseball after playing his whole life, and has a fight with his best friend. Then they suddenly meet a mysterious, red-eyed girl named Noruda, and a huge typhoon hits the middle school.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Natural Disaster
tags.description: It focuses on catastrophic events of natural origin, such as earthquakes, tsunamis,  volcanic eruptions, and severe storms. These works often present situations of extreme danger in which the characters struggle to survive and overcome the adversity.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tete_hiroyasu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/ishidahiroyasutete) 

Former student of Kyoto Seika University, currently employed at Studio Colorido.

He gained notoriety on the internet during his university years thanks to the short "Fumiko no Kokuhaku," a two-minute-long animation released in 2009 (when he was only 21) and produced entirely by himself. The short attracted attention internationally and won him the Japanese YouTube Video Award. He graduated in 2011 with the project "Rain Town."

He has won several awards as a young and emergent artist, his work has been featured in the Newtype magazine and praised by the likes of [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tete_hiroyasu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/ishidahiroyasutete) 

Former student of Kyoto Seika University, currently employed at Studio Colorido.

He gained notoriety on the internet during his university years thanks to the short "Fumiko no Kokuhaku," a two-minute-long animation released in 2009 (when he was only 21) and produced entirely by himself. The short attracted attention internationally and won him the Japanese YouTube Video Award. He graduated in 2011 with the project "Rain Town."

He has won several awards as a young and emergent artist, his work has been featured in the Newtype magazine and praised by the likes of [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/).

Masashi Hamauzu is a Japanese video game composer who was employed at Square Enix from 1996 to 2010. He is best known for his work on the Final Fantasy and SaGa series. Born into a musical family in Germany, Hamauzu was raised in Japan. He became interested in music while in kindergarten, and got piano lessons from his parents.    Hamauzu was hired by Square (now Square Enix) as a trainee, and his debut as a solo composer came the following year when he scored Chocobo no Fushigina Dungeon. He has collaborated with his friend and fellow composer Junya Nakano on several games, and has worked closely with synthesizer programmer Ryo Yamazaki on most titles since SaGa Frontier 2.    After Nobuo Uematsu left Square Enix in 2004, Hamauzu took over as the leading composer of the company's music team. He was the sole composer for Final Fantasy XIII. He has also become a renowned piano arranger, and has arranged a number of albums, including Yasunori Mitsuda's Sailing to the World piano score in 2006. His music incorporates various styles, although he mostly uses classical and ambient music in his pieces. In 2010, Hamauzu left Square Enix to start his own studio, Monomusik.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bahijd) | [Tumblr](http://bahijd.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bahijd)

Freelance animator from Austria who gained attraction on the internet thanks to his gif animations, which then served as a stepping stone for him joining the industry. Made his proper debut on [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/)'s adaptation of [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/). His cuts are often heavily layered, exploiting the unique potential of digital processing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Skullgirls (Video Game, 2012) (Character and Effects Animation)
- Carpainter - Digital Harakiri (Music Album, 2015) (Cover Illustration)
- Death Stranding (Video Game, 2019) (Concept Art)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pochi1989) | [Tumblr](https://pochi1989.tumblr.com/)

Initially from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Currently employed at [Studio Colorido](https://anilist.co/studio/4419/).

Also an illustrator of novels and children's books.

__Brother:__ [Kazuki Ozaki](https://twitter.com/kazuki_ozaki)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuuki_ozaki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yukiozaki_kp/)__

Yuuki Ozaki, also known under his solo alias as warbear, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, guitarist and member of [Galileo Galilei](https://anilist.co/staff/107557/Galileo-Galilei) and [BBHF](https://anilist.co/staff/174061/BBHF). He is one of the original members of Galileo Galilei during their initial run between 2007-2016.

In 2022 alongside his brother Kazuki Ozaki, who is another original member of Galileo Galilei, he would go on to reform the band with him and 2 others after a 6 year hiatus.

[Website](https://www.galileogalilei.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/galileo_news) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/galileogalileiphoto/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/galileogalileiofficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/galileogalileiSMEJ)

Galileo Galilei is a Japanese four-piece rock band who were initially active between 2007 to 2016, however they made a return in 2022 and have since resumed band activities. They are signed to independent record label Ouchi Daisuki Club Records (2022–), but were signed to SME Records (2007–2016). 

At their first Nippon Budokan performance held on October 11, 2016 it was announced that they would retire. After the band retired, Yuuki Ozaki, Kazuki Ozaki and Hitoshi Sakou continued in a new band named [BBHF](https://anilist.co/staff/174061).

The band announced a return on October 11, 2022 at the warbear's "re:bear" live concert after an exact 6 years hiatus. Upon returning their lineup consisted of two of the original members Yuuki Ozaki and Kazuki Ozaki, accompanied by Fumito Iwai and Masaki Okazaki. Their first album release after returning was Bee And The Whales on May 31st, 2023.

On August 30, 2023 they had a special collaboration with [Porter Robinson](https://anilist.co/staff/120603/Porter-Robinson) with a new take on the song "[Circle Game -ANOHANA Ver.-](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H6CE9uJwH8U)". The original version of the song first appeared in the movie adaption of the anime _[Anohana the Movie: The Flower We Saw That Day](https://anilist.co/anime/15039/Ano-Hi-Mita-Hana-no-Namae-wo-Bokutachi-wa-Mada-Shiranai-Movie/)_.

__Members:__
- [Yuuki Ozaki](https://anilist.co/staff/149245/Yuuki-Ozaki) (尾崎雄貴) – vocalist, guitarist, synthesizer, programmer, in-charge of lyrics and composition (2007–2016, 2022–)
- Kazuki Ozaki (尾崎和樹) – drummer, guitarist, percussionist, rhythm machine, synthesizer, programmer (2007–2016, 2022–)
- Fumito Iwai (岩井郁人) – guitarist, bassist, chorus, synthesizer, programmer (2009–2012, 2022–)
- Masaki Okazaki (岡崎真輝) – bassist (2022–)

__Former Members:__
- Hitoshi Sakou (佐孝仁司) – bassist, guitarist, synthesizer, programmer (2007–2016)
- Souhei Funaya (船谷創平) – guitarist (2007–2009)
- Kazumasa Noguchi (野口一雅) – pianist, organist, bassist, percussionist, synthesizer (2011–2012)

__Brother:__ [Kazuki Ozaki](https://twitter.com/kazuki_ozaki)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuuki_ozaki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yukiozaki_kp/)__
